reviewText: Absolutely one of the worst movies I have ever seen!!
New meaning to Theater of the Absurd.  A fantastic, dirty allegory rife with  brilliant camera work, outstanding actors, macabre vision.

I rented this movie and within ten minutes wish that Amazon had a cancel this order button . I found the film disjointed, silly, confusing, and all around not worthy of a watch. It could have been connected into some kind of coherent story but there seemed to be no desire or effort to do so. What was the clown all about? For that matter what was the entire thing about? Would I recommend it to a friend? Not if I wanted to keep their friendship.

Ugh. Wanna-be Insane Clown Posse + full retard = Devil Girl. Lame acting, lame plot... just more bad c-horror/comedy microbudget weekend shoot time waster. They seem to have had fun making it, and while it's terrible, the 420 crowd might enjoy it.

DEVIL GIRL is the story of Fay (Jessica Graham), her '69 Chavelle, and the eeevil, psychopathic clown (Joe Wanjai Ross) who haunts her. Fay is also haunted by the memory of her dead father. When her car breaks down near a small, hick town in Texas, Fay tries to get a job as a bartender (The clown stole her money), but can only find work as a stripper. Fay's adventure includes run-ins w/ a sleazy preacher, a scumbag motel manager, and the DEVIL GIRL (Vanessa Kay) herself! Yep, she's red, she's hot, and she's got horns and a tail! She also drives a wicked T-Bird! The story is fairly non-linear. There's a definite psychedelic / dream-like / hallucinatory effect and atmosphere. The clown is hilarious! He has the best lines in the movie. If you enjoy fast cars, drug-crazed killer clowns, or bodacious red gals, then you have just found Paradise!...

Years ago, I was lucky enough to catch the premier of this film.

You ever love a movie that most people do not? Apparently history has put me in such a place. After all of this time I still enjoy this flawed gem. Yes, there are things this first time group of filmmakers could have done different or better, but that can be said for pretty much every movie ever made.

I know from experience that not everyone plugs into this mile-a-minute movie, but I sure did. In fact, the filmmakers found my original review for DEVIL GIRL online at Feo Amante's Horror Thriller, and put my blurb right on the cover of this DVD!

So yeah, this movie holds a special place in my heart. If you are a gearhead and into fast cars and the whole custom car show ethos, you may wind up wowed yourself. Fast and Furious fans take note: This one might have slipped right past you.
the movie sucks, its a low budget film but the two scene with the she devil were worth it for me lol

I'm not going to pretend that I purchased this film because I like avant- garde' cinema, because I don't.  I purchased it because I like Vanessa Kay from "The Man Show" who plays the titular (get it!) role of "Devil Girl".  Now, if she happens to be in a great movie, well, that's a plus.  That was just not the case.  The entire cast couldn't act its way out of a snuff film.  The story is pedantic and frequently makes absolutely no sense.  There is not a single likeable or redeemable character from beginning to end.  The dialogue is simply painful.  Most of the time you are left asking yourself two questions, "What the..." and, "Who talks like that?"  The cinematography isn't awful, but is that why you want to watch a film, because it "isn't awful"?  I guess this movie has a certain Mystery Science Theatre quality to it, in that it deserves to be lampooned and verbally eviscerated.  All in all, save your money and your time.  I still like Vanessa Kay, and I hope one day she finds her vehicle, this isn't it.  The rest of the cast and crew should seriously rethink their career paths.
I love this movie!  The movie gets a little weird and the ending is unexpected.  The clown is hysterical and definitely my favorite character.  I'd watch this movie every day
Its like a Rob Zombie movie from an alternate reality where Rob Zombies mom smoked crack while she was pregnant.

If you're looking for some high-concept, art house horror, look elsewhere. If your looking for fun, some gore, and sexy women, look no further! Not perfect, but enjoyable. Plus lots of burlesque girls sprinkled in here and there. If the cover of the movie is what drew you in, you'll have a good time.

As far as low budget indie films go, I found this one to be quite entertaining and posseses many unique ideas and plot lines. And for once the poster depicted for the film has something to do with the movie. The writer/director of the film, Howie Askins, has gone on to do several other movies with critical acclaim according to imdb.com so Im looking forward to seeing them since I know from seeing this one I won't be bored.
To me this movie is proof that interesting and entertaining results can be achieved by determined and creative people even on a low budget.

I watched this movie and ignored the poor reviews and one star haters. I like to decide for myself. What I decided is that I liked this movie a lot. This is not a perfect movie. This is not the best of all time or the best B-rated of all time. What it was, was fun. I can't explain it better than fun. I enjoy when crazy stuff is happening, even if I don't understand why. This movie is not some artistic film that shows how flawed humans are. We know we are flawed. This movie is full of flawed people. The clown guy was the most maniacal of them all. Half the time I didn't know what the hell he was rambling on about, but I didn't care. It was funny and fun to watch. This is not a movie for the powder puff horror genre. If you don't like things like Devils Rejects or Natural Born Killers, then this won't be your bag. And just so you know, in no way does this movie stand up to the movies I just mentioned. Not even close, bud!

Based on the unique relationships between characters and the seemingly odd flashbacks, it was difficult attempting to make sense of the flow.
However, once you view the final scene, it comes together deceptively well.
I was scratching my head as I watched this trying to figure out what was going on in the characters heads or if their situations were in fact real.
After viewing the ending, everything made sense.
This is worth the watch.

For a B Movie, this one was very well done. Has a Stephen King-ish quality to it, engaging storyline, and excellent acting from the major characters. The creepy clown seamlessly flip-flops from raging psychopath to shy, awkward young man. As stated by others, the film has a
drug-induced dreamlike quality to most of it, but there was a neat "O. Henry" twist at the end that left me feeling like "Yeah, Cool, I can dig it".

  Definitely not for the kids, but this has the quality to become a cult classic. Some nice old Detroit muscle cars included: Chevelles, T-Birds, etc.
And yes, Devil Girl was hot, in more ways than one! I took off one star for the excessive heavy-handed small town fire-and-brimstone preaching scenes - was annoying and a lot of it could have been left out. But I saw at the end why they felt like it was necessary. Amazon has some real
duds in here, but this wasn't one of them.

I was so bored to tears I had to stop it a couple of times to do other things.  For me, I'd have to say, this isn't even worth a one time viewing.  Very limited nipular content, more teasing than anything else.  Save your money.

There are all kinds of perverts, crazies, super-naturals and even has a nonsensical BDSM scene just to keep the confusion up. It rates a 2/5 on the T&A scale.
